div.h2: This Resource Page will serve as your hub-spot for all School Closure Information

div.class: image-block-outer-wrapper layout-caption-below design-layout-inline combination-animation-none individual-animation-none individual-text-animation-none

div.h1: NEW ADJUSTMENT TO OUR FOOD DISTRIBUTION SCHEDULE - STARTING APRIL 20TH

div.h2:
Meals will be served MONDAY - WEDNESDAY from 11:30am-1:00pm.
On Wednesday, students will receive (4) additional meals for Thursday and Friday.
div.p: Each student will receive a free bagged lunch and breakfast, for the following day, to any child, ages 1-18 in an easy drive-thru or walk-up location. This includes any siblings.

span.strong: We recommend using the drive-thru and, if possible, the use of a face mask.

div.p:
• Sherwood Elementary (110 S. Wood Street, 93905)
• Kammann Elementary (521 Rochex Avenue, 93906)
• Mission Park Elementary (403 W. Acacia Street., 93901)

div.p: Thank you for your patience while we work to provide support to our students during this challenging time. THANK YOU to all of the teachers, administrators, and classified staff who scrambled to make these available for our use. As a reminder, these are Enrichment Opportunities and are voluntary for students and families to complete.
One letter to accompany each packet. The letter is in English and Spanish. If students have access to their QR codes, they can also access the digital resources.

div.h3: BEFORE YOU COME: PLEASE DO THE FOLLOWING
div.p:
1. Go to your child’s school
You will want to go to the specific school that your child attends.
2. Bring your student/s with you.
(if your child(ren) are truly sick, please bring your student’s Clever card that was mailed to you with their progress report cards).
3. Check-Out Agreement
Parents or legal guardians are the only ones that can pick up the devices because an agreement must be signed.
4. Bring your ID/Contact Info
Bring your (parent) contact information (an identification card might be requested to ensure that devices are given to the correct students).

strong.br: Please be patient during this distribution.

li.p: Parents will need to sign forms accepting responsibility for the technology devices.
We must ensure accountability for all devices that are distributed.
Distribution needs to be done in an orderly and organized fashion.
We must practice ‘social distancing’ which means having 6 feet between each other.

div.h3:
MUSIC AND ART PROJECTS
FROM MR. CASSADY AND MR. GRIFFIN
div.p: Hello students and families of SCESD! Even though we are not able to meet in person, we still want to give you chances to keep participating in our Music and Art programs! Below is a list of activities and opportunities. Come join us when you have a chance!
